description.narrative: Australia is committed to work at all levels of society in partner countries to support improvements in government capability, responsiveness to citizen and accountability. Australia continues to support engagement between communities and government, to improve the ability of citizens to participate in making decision that impact on their lives. The Australia Vanuatu Joint Development Cooperation Strategy 2005-2010 focuses on political governance, particularly the objective to “improve governance through strengthening the stability and reach of key institutions”. The Strategy identifies strengthening partnerships and working with civil society to promote demand-led governance as key means by which to meet this objective. In response, AusAID has developed a program of activities to foster community engagement, media effectiveness and leadership in Vanuatu.
